projectDesc.p: This project seeks to identify, collect, preserve, and analyze FREEDOM discourse, as constituted and argued by Black users online. Directed by Dr. Jessica H. Lu, this project is currently being advanced by several undergraduate students at the University of Maryland, College Park: Sophia Crooks, Kayla Graham, Kaanita Iyer, Ariana Lawson, Alice Liu, and Courtney Richardson.

org.note: The Root is an online magazine that centralizes African American thoughts, experiences, and news. Felicia Leatherwood is featured in a few of their articles.
HBO a televison network that includes the TV show, Insecure, starring Issa Rae. Felicia Leatherwood is Rae's hairstylist on the show.

Twitter is a social networking website and app where users post and engage with tweets. Black people on Twitter have created the digital space, "Black Twitter," where participants engage with culturally similar users within the larger Twitter "world."

Yara Shahidi is an actor know for her roles is the ABC series Black-ish and Grown-ish. Shahidi's hair is styled by Felcia Leatherwood.

Ava DuVernay is a film writer, producer, and director who has worked on several films and TV shows including Selma, Queen Sugar, and A Wrinkle in Time. Duvernay is also a client of Felicia Leatherwood.

body.p: You sit in my chair, I make sure that I introduce myself to your hair. I feel it. I massage the scalp. I just get familiar. With Issa — she just lets me create.
I do not realize how much Issa Rae’s hair has impacted the natural hair community.

With Issa Rae on Insecure, we did like — 100 hair styles last season. I’m reading the script and I’m like, OK, this hairstyle should last for 2 days. But we got so into it because the way you shoot is out of sequence. And people — they would go on Twitter and say, “OK, so she had one hairstyle for breakfast and another one for lunch.” But they loved it. What ever you see on straight hair, I feel I can create it with natural hair. I started doing hair when I was itty-bitty young because no one could do my hair. When I went to the salon as a kid, it was like, “Oh she’s got long hair and it’s straight and beautiful. How can I get that?” And I didn’t get that. That was not my hair. Susan Kelechi Watson from This Is Us is one of my clients; Yara Shahidi, Ava DuVernay, Lena Waithe. I draw my inspiration from the old and the new. I may go all the way back to a style out of Africa from the 1800s. Old braid styles that have been forgotten. I also will go to old Hollywood. All the YouTubers and the bloggers, all the young girls creating in their bathroom, videotaping—I watch them. Every time I create or design a hairstyle that I know will be on the carpet or go viral, it is always about the community of natural hair. We are innovators. We will always be.
